result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelvin D Clemons

records.addlTxt:
Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Kruger states that as long as the information mirrors the complaint, she will proceed. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  Atty Kruger enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Set status
bond continued

1:55 PM Defendant Kelvin D Clemons appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Kruger appeared by video for Kelvin D Clemons.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Kruger states that an offer was received this morning.  Atty Kruger states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:21 AM Defendant Kelvin D Clemons appeared by video.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck appeared by video for Kelvin D Clemons.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schonscheck states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. Atty Schonscheck waives time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection

3:28 PM Defendant Kelvin D Clemons appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for PD appointment.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to get counsel.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
